title: Adorable moment NBC newsreader is interrupted by her young son during broadcast
text:
This is the adorable moment an NBC reporter was interrupted by her young son during a live news broadcast.

Courtney Kube was reporting on the ongoing conflict in Syria on Wednesday morning from the network's Washington DC studios when her little boy wandered onto the set.

Kube, who is NBC's national security and military reporter, was ever-the-professional as her cheeky toddler began hugging her and tried to pull on her hair.

'Excuse me, my kids are here!' Kube smiled as she tried to remove her son from the camera's view.

'Live television!' she then chuckled, before a quick-thinking producer quickly cut away and put a graphic on the screen.

Kube remained unflustered, as she seamlessly continued to discuss the situation in the Middle East.

The TV star is mom to twin boys, Jake and Ryan, but it's unclear which of them strolled onto the set.

MSNBC tweeted out the adorable moment shortly after it occurred, accompanied by the caption: 'Sometimes unexpected breaking news happens while you're reporting breaking news.'

They added the hashtags: 'MSNBC moms' and 'working moms'.

Kube won praise for her professionalism, with many leaving comments beneath the post.

'Handled it very professionally. Cute moment,' one wrote.

'Kudos to her pulling it together after that. That’s a pro right there. Well done!' another wrote.

Kube has been an NBC employee for almost two decades and often brings her twin boys to the TV studios.

Earlier this year she shared a photo of her sons in the network's greenroom, while a separate snap showed the tots sitting at a studio desk with grins on their faces.

The popular presenter has been married to her Marine husband, Eric Dent, since 2013.

Wednesday's adorable moment was reminiscent of a 2017 BBC broadcast in which an on-camera expert had his own interview gatecrashed by his toddler.

Professor Robert Kelly appeared on BBC from his home office to discuss South Korean politics when his daughter entered the room.

The little girl was seen dancing and singing before her mother quickly came chasing after her and move her away from the screen.
